title: U.S. Seeks Coalition To Fight ISIS
teaser: French president Francois Holland is in Iraq as France considers whether to contribute airstrikes to the U.S. effort to stop the Islamic State.
contentencoded:
Secretary of State John Kerry is in Turkey trying to persuade leaders there to aid in the fight against the Islamic State, also known as ISIS or ISIL.

Meantime, France’s president Francois Hollande visited Baghdad and Erbil as he considers whether France will contribute air strikes to the effort.

Paris will host an international conference on Monday to coordinate support for Iraq in the fight against the Islamic State.

President Obama outlined a plan for defeat the Sunni militant group earlier this week.

The Washington Post’s Greg Jaffe joins Here & Now’s Sacha Pfeiffer from Erbil in Iraq to describe the mood there.

Guest

  • Greg Jaffe, reporter for the Washington Post in Erbil, Iraq. He tweets @GregJaffe.
